intro: Ricinus communis var. japonicus, commonly known as Japanese castor oil plant, is a variant of the castor oil plant native to Japan. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces spiny capsules that contain toxic, oily seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
